question.body: Using this same histogram of 105 patients, which of the following is most likely to be true?

multiple_choice.choice: The mean will be larger than the median.
The median will be larger than the mean.
The mean and median will be about the same.

response.feedback: Correct. Since the distribution is skewed right, the mean will be larger than the median.
Incorrect. The mean is influenced by outliers. Since there are outliers in the right-hand part of the distribution, the mean will be pulled toward that end of the distribution.
Incorrect. Remember, the mean is influenced by outliers. Since there are outliers in the right-hand part of the distribution, the mean and median will not be equal.

part.hint: You are trying to figure out the relationship between the median and the mean.
Look at the shape of the distribution and note any possible outliers. How might outliers affect the median and mean?

Since there are 105 patients and two outliers (in the 500 to 540 range), we know that the distribution is skewed right. What is the relationship between the mean and median in a skewed-right distribution?
